meanings.sent1: After realizing the mistake, she decided to replanning her trip.
meanings.sent2: They had to replanning their strategy after the unexpected setback.
meanings.sent3: The group had to replanning their picnic due to the sudden rainstorm.
meanings.sent4: Just like a captain adjusting the sails, she was replanning her course.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was replanning the layout of the flower beds to maximize sunlight.

meanings.sent1: He was replanning his schedule to fit in the new meeting.
meanings.sent2: She was replanning her budget to save up for the vacation.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to replanning the menu when the main ingredient ran out.
meanings.sent4: Like a puzzle solver, she was replanning her route to avoid traffic.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was replanning the lesson to include more interactive activities.

meanings.definition: The act of creating a new plan
meanings.sent1: The replanning of the project brought fresh ideas to the table.
meanings.sent2: His replanning of the event made it more successful than before.
meanings.sent3: The sudden change required quick replanning to ensure everything went smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The replanning of the garden layout transformed the space completely.
meanings.sent5: Her replanning of the room layout made it more spacious and functional.
